gov.nasa.worldwind.formats.shapefile

Class ShapefileRecord

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nasa.worldwind.formats.shapefile.ShapefileRecord
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ShapefileRecordMultiPoint, ShapefileRecordNull, ShapefileRecordPoint, ShapefileRecordPolyline

    public abstract class ShapefileRecord
extends Object
    Represents a single record of a shapefile.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ShapefileRecord

        public ShapefileRecord(Shapefile shapeFile,
                       ByteBuffer buffer)
        Constructs a record instance from the given ByteBuffer. The buffer's current position must be the start of the record, and will be the start of the next record when the constructor returns.
        Parameters:
        shapeFile - the parent Shapefile.
        buffer - the shapefile record ByteBuffer to read from.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if any argument is null or otherwise invalid.
        WWRuntimeException - if the record's shape type does not match that of the shapefile.

    • Method Detail

      • getShapeFile

        public Shapefile getShapeFile()
        Returns the shapefile containing this record.
        Returns:
        the shapefile containing this record.

      • getRecordNumber

        public int getRecordNumber()
        Returns the zero-orgin ordinal position of the record in the shapefile.
        Returns:
        the record's ordinal position in the shapefile.

      • getShapeType

        public String getShapeType()
        Returns the record's shape type.
        Returns:
        the record' shape type. See Shapefile for a list of the defined shape types.

      • getNumberOfPoints

        public int getNumberOfPoints(int partNumber)
        Returns the number of points in a specified part of the record.
        Parameters:
        partNumber - the part number for which to return the number of points.
        Returns:
        the number of points in the specified part.

      • getPointBuffer

        public VecBuffer getPointBuffer(int partNumber)
        Returns the VecBuffer holding the X and Y points of a specified part.
        Parameters:
        partNumber - the part for which to return the point buffer.
        Returns:
        the buffer holding the part's points. The points are ordered X0,Y0,X1,Y1,...Xn-1,Yn-1, where "n" is the number of points in the part.

      • getCompoundPointBuffer

        public CompoundVecBuffer getCompoundPointBuffer()
        Returns the CompoundVecBuffer holding all the X and Y points for this record. The returned buffer contains one sub-buffer for each of this record's parts. The coordinates for each part are referenced by invoking CompoundVecBuffer.subBuffer(int), where the index is one of this record's part IDs, starting with 0 and ending with getNumberOfParts() - 1 (inclusive).
        Returns:
        a CompoundVecBuffer that holds this record's coordinate data.

      • getBoundingRectangle

        public abstract double[] getBoundingRectangle()
        Returns a four-element array containing this record's bounding rectangle, or null if this record has no bounding rectangle.

        The returned array is ordered as follows: minimum Y, maximum Y, minimum X, and maximum X. If the Shapefile's coordinate system is geographic, the elements can be interpreted as angular degrees in the order minimum latitude, maximum latitude, minimum longitude, and maximum longitude.

        Returns:
        the record's bounding rectangle, or null to indicate that this record does not have a bounding rectangle.

      • doReadFromBuffer

        protected abstract void doReadFromBuffer(Shapefile shapefile,
                                         ByteBuffer buffer)
        Reads and parses subclass-specific contents of a shapefile record from a specified buffer. The buffer's current position must be the start of the subclass' unique contents and will be the start of the next record when the constructor returns.
        Parameters:
        shapefile - the containing Shapefile.
        buffer - the shapefile record ByteBuffer to read from.

      • readFromBuffer

        protected void readFromBuffer(Shapefile shapefile,
                              ByteBuffer buffer)
        Reads and parses the contents of a shapefile record from a specified buffer. The buffer's current position must be the start of the record and will be the start of the next record when the constructor returns.
        Parameters:
        shapefile - the containing Shapefile.
        buffer - the shapefile record ByteBuffer to read from.

      • validateShapeType

        protected void validateShapeType(Shapefile shapefile,
                                 String shapeType)
        Verifies that the record's shape type matches the expected one, typically that of the shapefile. All non-null records in a Shapefile must be of the same type. Throws an exception if the types do not match and the shape type is not Shapefile.SHAPE_NULL. Records of type SHAPE_NULL are always valid, and may appear in any Shapefile.

        For details, see the ESRI Shapefile specification at , pages 4 and 5.

        Parameters:
        shapefile - the shapefile.
        shapeType - the record's shape type.
        Throws:
        WWRuntimeException - if the shape types do not match.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified shape type is null.

      • isMeasureType

        protected boolean isMeasureType()
        Indicates whether the record is a shape type capable of containing optional measure values. Does not indicate whether the record actually contains measure values.
        Returns:
        true if the record may contain measure values.

      • isZType

        protected boolean isZType()
        Indicates whether the record is a shape type containing Z values.
        Returns:
        true if the record is a type containing Z values.

      • isNullRecord

        public boolean isNullRecord()
        Indicates whether this is a null record. When true, this record may be cast to a ShapefileRecordNull by calling asNullRecord().
        Returns:
        true if this is a null record, otherwise false.

      • isPointRecord

        public boolean isPointRecord()
        Indicates whether this is a point record. When true, this record may be cast to a ShapefileRecordPoint by calling asPointRecord().
        Returns:
        true if this is a point record, otherwise false.

      • isMultiPointRecord

        public boolean isMultiPointRecord()
        Indicates whether this is a multi point record. When true, this record may be cast to a ShapefileRecordMultiPoint by calling asPointRecord().
        Returns:
        true if this is a multi point record, otherwise false.

      • isPolylineRecord

        public boolean isPolylineRecord()
        Indicates whether this is a polyline record. When true, this record may be cast to a ShapefileRecordPolyline by calling asPolylineRecord().
        Returns:
        true if this is a polyline record, otherwise false.

      • isPolygonRecord

        public boolean isPolygonRecord()
        Indicates whether this is a polygon record. When true, this record may be cast to a ShapefileRecordPolygon by calling asPolygonRecord().
        Returns:
        true if this is a polygon record, otherwise false.

      • asNullRecord

        public ShapefileRecordNull asNullRecord()
        Returns this record as a ShapefileRecordNull. This results in a class cast exception if this is not a null record. Check this record's type using isNullRecord() prior to calling this method.
        Returns:
        this record cast as a ShapefileRecordNull.

      • asPointRecord

        public ShapefileRecordPoint asPointRecord()
        Returns this record as a ShapefileRecordPoint. This results in a class cast exception if this is not a point record. Check this record's type using isPointRecord() prior to calling this method.
        Returns:
        this record cast as a ShapefileRecordPoint.

      • asMultiPointRecord

        public ShapefileRecordMultiPoint asMultiPointRecord()
        Returns this record as a ShapefileRecordMultiPoint. This results in a class cast exception if this is not a multi point record. Check this record's type using isMultiPointRecord() prior to calling this method.
        Returns:
        this record cast as a ShapefileRecordMultiPoint.

      • isNormalizePoints

        public boolean isNormalizePoints()
        Returns whether the record's point coordinates should be normalized.
        Returns:
        true if the record's points should be normalized; false otherwise.

      • setNormalizePoints

        public void setNormalizePoints(boolean normalizePoints)
        Specifies if the record's point coordinates should be normalized. Defaults to false.
        Parameters:
        normalizePoints - true if the record's points should be normalized; false otherwise.

      • exportAsKML

        public void exportAsKML(javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamWriter xmlWriter)
                 throws IOException,
                        javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamException
        Export the record as KML. This implementation does nothing; subclasses may override this method to provide KML export.
        Parameters:
        xmlWriter - Writer to receive KML.
        Throws:
        IOException - If an exception occurs while writing the KML
        javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamException - If an exception occurs while exporting the data.
